caption: It's a hidden gem I must say in the heart of Paris. It's clean but as there is some peacocks so it makes the garden a but dirty. But it's a worth visit in the summer days. A large scale places with numerous ponds with beautiful attractions of the French history.  There is Public toilets and proper bus stands near by this park. It's a well maintained place.in summer the rose garden becomes more beautiful and the scenic view blooms everywhere in this park. It's wheel chair accessible and nice tracks for jogging and walking for every age of persons. Just recommended for visitors who wants to see some natural views. It's better to come in the early morning time because that time we can enjoy the most gorgeous views of the animals here.
The scenery is breathtaking, I loved visiting this in Autumn! I wish I could have finished exploring it, but I didn‚Äôt have enough time. I will have to come back for more, it was totally worth it!

The garden was nice. There are different sections like rose garden, tulips garden waterfall and more. There‚Äôs a hill you can go there and have a beautiful park and city view. In the garden you‚Äôll see a lot of birds and cats . Fun fact there are a lot of cats in the park. The worst thing about the park was service area or bathroom. They were so dirty. The problem was not people using them dirty it was luck of care. The garbage cans were full and not enough.

A charming park on the outskirts of Paris, about 15-20 minute stroll from the line 1 metro station at Pont de Neuilly. Calm, sunny, has an amazing rose garden (late May-June and September blooming), featuring lots of curious peacocks that would follow you around and display their fanciful plumage. This is also a perfect place to spend time in as a family with little children, as the park has playgrounds and lawns for picnic. It's a must-go for flower enthusiasts; the variety and beauty of blossoms on the flower beds and the trees throughout the park will not disappoint.

Absolutely fantastic experience I had at this park üòå. Especially when the peacock comes near youü§©... They are used to with the visitors, and we can see their magical beauty so closely ‚ù§Ô∏è. This park is huge, so you can spend a whole day just roaming, sitting and watching the "Roserie" (rose garden). I will definitely recommend this park.
It's the most beautiful park in Paris. Roses, peonies, lakes, peacocks. Not crowded
The roseraie has less species of roses. However there are some bushes grown for competition for 2025 and 2026. It is a big and pleasant park to stroll.

I want to start this off by saying what an amazing garden!! I was definitely not expecting such a big and well put together garden. There were so many different parts there : the Japanese fountain, rosary, maze and even a waterfall. It is absolutely huge (25 hectares) but still doable : you can go there, walk through it for about half an hour and have a pic nic, I think it would be perfect. It‚Äôs not as big as Boulogne or Vincennes but not small as any other Parisian park.

For sure you have to pay 4 euro but personally I think it is the best park you can find in Paris. It is simply astonishing!!! Go there to relax on Saturday and Sunday, you will feel like Alice in Wonderland

A perfect place in  western Paris to spend a sunny summer afternoon/ evening. Highly recommend it. So relaxing with a laid back atmosphere.The bus takes you just outside one of the main gates. When getting the bus the other way it then took us back all the way to Gare De Nord. Will recommend to all family and friends when they are in Paris. Only a small admission fee. Thank you.

Very nice place. If you're planning to visit, make sure to book your whole day because you're gonna need it. There is an entrance fee of 2.5 ‚Ç¨ and a discount for students. The parc is really beautiful and well taken care of. You enjoy walking, sitting, and it is huge! There is also a small variety of birds and animals, and i think you can go canoing. There is also an area planted with a huge variety of roses and flowers! Really recommend it.
A lovely green escape in Paris. Really peaceful und relaxing. But be careful ‚Ä¶ there are a lot of cute cats everywhere üòÉ ‚Ä¶

This park is very beautiful. It's not as crowded as some of the parks and the woods provide nice shade on a warm day. The peacocks that wonder around the property provide a lot of entertainment as well. Make sure to check out the Rose garden if you go.

We visited the parc on May 30th. It is a paradise garden! The roses, of many different colors and species, were magnificent. There were probably twenty peacocks, walking very close to humans. The parking is just next to the entrance, but on a nice day it can get completely full in the afternoon.

We went pique-nique the as my friend recommended me to go there.  By payinh 2,5 euros per person, we were not disappointed.  While having pique-nique, there was a peacock approaching us in less than 1 meters from where we sat (what an experience). There are a lot of peacocks in fact.  We love the rose garden and the English style garden. Plus, there was a concert going on the the orangerie building. Awesome.  I will be back. üòá

I liked it! Seemed like lots of locals. Its probably amazing in the summer. There were peacocks! At first I was nervous because it didn't seem that many people were around, but once you reach the clearing where the statues are, there's plenty of benches and people. Or you can go off the to the sides and there's little tucked away spots if you want more privacy.

Very beautiful garden with a lot of spots to explore. They are many different things to see, such a big rocks, waterfalls, lakes, different kinds of flowers and plants, and plenty of peacocks. This is free during fall/winter and 2,5‚Ç¨ in spring/summer. Really recommended.

Absolutely one of my favorite Paris parks. Did my wedding photos here(obviously the ones posted aren‚Äôt the real professional ones! Haha)! It‚Äôs always empty, it‚Äôs big and spacious, and it‚Äôs easy to get to by bus or car! Buy tickets online ahead of time or at the gate :)
Beautiful park with amazing rose garden and irises. Definitely worth to see, small nominal fee applied to enter the park

One of the most beautiful parcs in Paris.. Very rich and charming and clean too.. The roseraie is a perfect place to be, for flowers and greenery lovers, and perfect too for a photo session üì∏... Don't make any plans before going there, enjoying is guaranteed, just go and discover every corner.. The artificial water falls are great, you'll find many in there, but I guess the year of 2020 they stopped them (not sure).. The only disadvantage is that it's a bit far.. Should go there in a car or biking.. Otherwise you'll walk a lot, so not so practical when it is too sunny!

It's a nice park with lots of gardens dedicated to different flowers. People with knowledge of plants and flowers will love it, and those who don't know much about flowers can still enjoy the sights. The garden is full of different landscapes, different types of birds including peacocks. Great place to be when the weather is nice. There is a restaurant as well and a small kiosque that sell small treats, but not much else. Toilet facilities are far in between, but the few that are there are clean.

Beautiful calm and romantic rose gardens with a view on the La D√©fense skyscrapers. Peacocks, a small waterfall and a highly romantic pagoda. A multitude of rose species flowering mainly in May-June.
Nice parc to visit during spring season.. you can see variety of flowers like magnolia, cherry blossoms.
Most amazing park. Very calm and really feel into the nature. There's some animals around and loooots of flowers.
It was really excited to see peacock. It will touch us and stay along with us for sometime.  Lot of varieties of roses, children playground is also available.
Absolutely gorgeous, beautifully landscaped, peacocks roaming around, lilies, peonies, roses, orangerie every section unique and worth exploring
Great and easy to reach park, lots of animals for children to see. Definitely worth going, free during winter.

Bagatelle is a wonderful place at almost any time of year, but particularly lovely in late Spring /early Summer - when the old roses, modern roses, irises, clematis etc are in bloom. Great spot for a picnic.
Parc de Bagatelle is worth visiting throughout the year. Wonderful to see the changes that come with the seasons.

The man at the counter is polite but the lady with glasses and braids is every unfriendly. Acts like a policeman and wave with her arms and when asked if she can talk in English she says with a frown 'NO' and goes back to her little loft. Why you work at a place where you possibly have to interact with foreign people, when it looks like you hate it? That I wonder. They way she treats me as her customer is like spitting on her own food.
Beautiful and quiet. Perfect for a gateway from the noisy city
Park is huge great for outdoor activities for friends and families.
Such a wonderful thing to see in the middle of Paris. A lot of free roaming peacocks, along with a variety of flowers
Had a brilliant experience - was attending an Absolutely breathtaking performance of the cirque du soleil, TOTEM, available till Dec 31st 2018 in a big top!  What a treat!
Worth to pay the entrance. We went there 2 weekend in a row.
Very nice Park, many peacocks
The most beautiful parc of Paris. Not crowded, clean, peaceful and incredbly beautiful.
What a lovely park. Very walkable, and must to see.
